image.altText: A solider bows his head in the rain

props.synopsis: 110 years after Australian and New Zealand soldiers landed on the Turkish coastline at Gallipoli, thousands of people have come together to mark ANZAC day.

title.children: 'We feel them still near us in spirit': Thousands turn out to mark Anzac Day

image.altText: Four brand new cars on a production line are inspected by factory workers.

props.synopsis: The Coalition's promise to end electric vehicle subsidies could drive up prices for popular EVs by more than $15,000 under a typical novated lease and have an almost immediate effect on sales.

title.children: Coalition vow to end EV lease discount may inflate prices $15K

image.altText: Pilbara Minerals spodumene rock

props.synopsis: China now dominates the entire rare earths ecosystem, refining around 90 per cent of all coveted elements. It leaves Trump's America particularly vulnerable, as the Albanese government proposes a national stockpile.Â

title.children: How Trump dealt himself a dud hand on rare earths

image.altText: Peter Dutton with Andrew Hastie, campaigning in Perth

props.synopsis: Whatever the result on May 3, even people within the Liberals think they have run a very poor national campaign. Not just poor, but odd.

title.children: Coalition's campaign lacks good planning and enough elbow grease

image.altText: Hundreds of people waive Pakistan flags and hold their fists in the air at a rally outside

props.synopsis: Days after a deadly attack left 26 people dead in India-controlled Kashmir, relations between the nuclear-armed neighbours have plummeted.

title.children: Pakistan warns India changes to water deal an 'act of war'

image.altText: Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin shake hands

props.synopsis: The US president has demanded Moscow cease bombardments of the Ukrainian capital as Washington attempts to broker a peace deal.Â

title.children: 'Vladimir, STOP!' Trump criticises Putin over Russian missile attack on Kyiv

image.altText: Composite Duttts Albo

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese have yet to set foot in an Indigenous community during their election campaigns. However, both have made multiple visits to Melbourne.Â

title.children: The places political leaders have been avoiding this election

image.altText: a man stands in a black suit and glasses stands at a podium that says 'Anzac Day'.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese will spend Anzac Day morning in Canberra, while Opposition Leader Peter Dutton is campaigning in his home city of Brisbane. Follow live.

title.children: Albanese and Dutton make Anzac Day statements as campaign continues

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ð¥ PM speaks at Dawn Service in Canberra
Peter Dutton attends Dawn Service in Brisbane

image.altText: A middle-aged, fair-haired woman in a brightly-coloured blazer.

props.synopsis: Katy Gallagher says her seniority as finance minister helps her advocate for Canberra. She admits independent Senator David Pocock is popular, but says her party has more muscle.

title.children: Gallagher seeks fourth Senate win but concedes Pocock's popularity

image.altText: A smiling young blonde woman with a black dog.

props.synopsis: The 53-year-old Sydney man accused of murdering the 19-year-old earlier this year has been found dead in his cell at Silverwater Correctional Complex.

title.children: Man charged with Audrey Griffin's murder found dead in prison cell

image.altText: A coffin, seen through the screen on a smart phone

props.synopsis: A Vatican official tells the ABC that taking pictures of, or with, the deceased pontiff is "frowned upon", as people snapping selfies becomes a phenomenon inside St Peter's Basilica.Â

title.children: Vatican responds as crowds take 'creepy' selfies with pope's body

image.altText: The two popes sit across from one another in a library with a large white box on the table between them

props.synopsis: Just 10 days after Pope Francis was appointed head of the Catholic Church, he received an ominous gift from his predecessor â a large white box.

title.children: Pope Francis was given a box full of 'abuse, corruption, dark dealings'

image.altText: A father stands with his arm around his young son's shoulders at war memorial.

props.synopsis: Anzac Day has always been difficult for Luke McCallum. But this year, for the first time since having his legs partially amputated, he's ready to march again.

title.children: Navy veteran overcame suicide attack and losing legs to march with son

image.altText: Man in plane wearing beret looking back at camera

props.synopsis: A World War II bomber pilot from Sydney reflects on his teary reunion with his mother, the Normandy landing and life after the war for Anzac Day 2025.

title.children: 102yo WWII veteran reflects on his 'marvellous' return home

image.altText: A soft and chewy Anzac biscuit, which is flat and wide.

props.synopsis: Like holding a minute's silence and playing the Last Post, Anzac biscuits are a big part of the national day of remembrance for many.Â

title.children: Chewy or crunchy? Here's how to make Anzac biscuits

image.altText: Beverley Minogue

props.synopsis: A pilot program at one of Australia's biggest emergency departments halves the number of older patients admitted to hospital.

title.children: Pilot program halves number of older patients taking up emergency ward beds

image.altText: Asian Elephant

props.synopsis: Test yourself with this week's quiz.Â

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Elephants farewelled, a trailblazing pope and an exchange of nice words

image.altText: A woman in a white top smiles and her 2 year old son sit at a table, look at the camera smiling

props.synopsis: Tax rebates for rural Australians were last updated more than 30 years ago. Voters say it is time for them to be on the election agenda.

title.children: Rural voters want zonal tax offset updates this election

image.altText: A group of police officers walking down a road securing a crime scene.

props.synopsis: A French high school student has killed one of his classmates and wounded three others, the latest in a spate of school incidents in the European country.

title.children: Macron hails 'courage' of teachers after deadly France school stabbing

image.altText: Ella Ramsay and Tara Kinder swim breaststroke composite

props.synopsis: Ella Ramsay and Tara Kinder could barely be separated all week, lining up in four finals across the Australian Open Swimming Championships in Brisbane, sharing four golds and four silvers between them.Â

title.children: The burgeoning rivalry that lit up the Australian swimming titles

image.altText: A group of pigs stand in hay.

props.synopsis: Australia's $6 billion pork industry is still waiting for a vaccine three years after a deadly outbreak of Japanese encephalitis virus.

title.children: Pork industry waits for vaccine three years after viral outbreak

image.altText: A group of people running under trees.

props.synopsis: An increasing number of women are signing up to local run clubs, even tackling their first marathon. But safety fears once the sun sets are hampering their training efforts.

title.children: As more women take part in running, there are growing fears for their safety

image.altText: Perth NRL fans

props.synopsis: Reports suggest a Perth-based NRL team is close to reality, but is this the one that sticks? Or is it just another false dawn for long-suffering NRL fans in the west?

title.children: The long and winding road to bring an NRL team to Perth

image.altText: israeli soldiers work on their tank near the israel and gaza border

props.synopsis: The strike on a "well known" United Nations compound last month left one employee of the organisation dead and forced the UN to temporarily reduce its staffing in Gaza.

title.children: Israeli tank fire responsible for deadly strike at UN facility in Gaza

image.altText: A man in a sweater stands in a native forest in New South Wales

props.synopsis: Former treasure secretary Ken Henry is pushing a new effort to protect native forests from logging and keep carbon stored in living trees.

title.children: Former treasury boss looking past logging to 'grow money on trees'

image.altText: A closeup of hands securing a round red pipe cutter onto a copper pipe.

props.synopsis: Copper thieves are suspected of targeting vacant homes using real estate websites, leaving real estate agents and plumbers to clean up the mess and owners to foot the bill.

title.children: Have an empty property? Thieves may be eyeing it for its copper

image.altText: Archival image of man with moustache wearing military unform

props.synopsis: Evelyn Scrub Memorial is emblematic of the war history for many rural towns where young men went to World War I and never returned. It has been given a new lease on life.Â

title.children: Tiny Queensland ghost town's sacrifice echoes Saving Private Ryan

image.altText: Video still of an argument at an election forum

props.synopsis: Kooyong MP Monique Ryan has condemned gatecrashers who interrupted an election forum on Wednesday night, which saw one audience member throw a punch.

title.children: Kooyong forum descends into chaos after 'right-wing bullies' gatecrash

image.altText: A render of the proposed Macquarie Point stadium, showing a wood-panelled round structure

props.synopsis: A new economic report commissioned by the Hobart City Council has found the stadium will deliver more than $140 million in economic impact to Hobart per year during the construction phase, and $178 million when operational.

title.children: Hobart will reap 'significant' economic benefits from stadium, report says

image.altText: An older man in tinted glasses among a crowd of people.

props.synopsis: Starring in more than 80 shows and movies over more than 50 years, Gerard Kennedy was famed for his rugged looks and intense performances.

title.children: Two-time Gold Logie winner Gerard Kennedy dies

image.altText: Dutton election campaign Tasmania

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton said some of the 41,000 cuts would be achieved by not proceeding with unfilled vacancies, but political opponents and experts say the numbers don't add up.

title.children: Public service cuts only for Canberra, Dutton says, which Labor calls 'impossible'

image.altText: A woman addresses the media in a press confernece.

props.synopsis: The NT government has promised to urgently pass new bail laws to bring the territory in-line with Victoria and NSW in the wake of a fatal stabbing of a local Darwin grocer.

title.children: Bail reform promised in wake of NT supermarket stabbing

image.altText: A mid shot of Lisa Govan posing for a photo smiling with her arms around a large dog while sitting at a table.

props.synopsis: A WA coroner indicates he'll be unable to determine how a woman died after she disappeared in Kalgoorlie more than 25 years ago.

title.children: Gang member breaks silence on woman missing from bikie clubhouse

image.altText: A woman sits with a typewriter on a brown wooden table.

props.synopsis: Pam Ashman has sat courtside for thousands of netball games, keeping score by hand and recording fixtures on her typewriter. Despite the painstaking work, the 78-year-old volunteer vows to "never ever" use a computer.

title.children: Trusty typewriter and a dedicated volunteer keeps netball league on track
